entities.name: fudge
entities.description: Fudge is described as a person who was once in need of help and advice from Dumbledore, but has now become confident and fond of power. He is also portrayed as someone who cannot accept the truth about Voldemort's return.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is described as a much more powerful wizard than Fudge, and is said to be stirring up trouble for the sake of it. He is also portrayed as someone who would not make things up.

entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort's return is mentioned as a problem that the Ministry has been trying to avoid for nearly fourteen years.

relationships.description: Fudge believes Dumbledore is lying and stirring up trouble.
Fudge denies the return of Voldemort, instead believing that Dumbledore is lying.
